subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Here's a question...
author: SnowfireL@aol.com
full_text:
-------------------------------1248727673
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

there are earth quakes everyday, this planet is alive, it's a dynamic  
earth, if there were no earth quakes, it would probably just explode from the  
pressure, so there has to be earth quakes to let off that pressure, and for  
there to be a hurricane in NJ this August , the ocean would need to really 
warm  up big time in the north, with the cold water in the northern Atlantic, 
 hurricanes don't usually like that sort of thing, they like the warmer 
waters  from the southern end mostly, Steve is worried about his  ghost house 
because he is in NJ.
Bonnie
 
 
In a message dated 7/27/2009 4:34:03 P.M. Eastern Daylight Time,  
purplealiengirl@... writes:

 
 
 
I have gotten some right on the money, predictions I thought "no friggin'  
way" like MJ being proven innocent in court, so I didn't post them. But then 
 there's the ever present "earthquake" with no location, date, or time. 
There's  earthquakes everyday.

Frank-S

--- In _EVP-ITC@yahoogroupsEVP-_ (mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com) , Zack  
Widup <w9sz.zack@.w9> wrote:
>
> Chris Moon aside, I  don't think there's any way you have of knowing.
> Especially when  predicting something to happen in the future. All you 
can do
> is wait  and see if it happens or not.
> 
> It's even more difficult than  telling if one of your friends is lying, 
which
> can be difficult enough  sometimes.
> 
> Zack
> 
> On Mon, Jul 27, 2009 at 9:31  AM, Rick <rasterer@..r> wrote:
> 
> >
>  >
> > Doesn't Chris Moon say there are only so many people who can  operate 
these
> > devices (30?), that that've been chosen to do  so?
> >
> > If so, and you are one of them, then you  shouldn't have to ask that
> > question. And if not, then I guess  asking doesn't help.
> >
> > --- In _EVP-ITC@yahoogroupsEVP-_ (mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com)   
<EVP-ITC%40yahoogroEVP-ITC>, Frank Sumption
> >  <purplealiengirl@> wrote:
> > >
> > > What  EVP statements does one choose to be false, and which is true? 
This
>  > is
> > > from that cell phone video, as noted, at the end  "earth is doomed". 
Do I
> > > just assume this must be negative,  so disregard it? Who's in charge 
of of
> > > determining what is  valid, and what is not?
> > >
> > > Frank-S
>  > >
> >
> > 
> >
>
